questions.question_text: An information security manager learns that business unit leaders are encouraging increased use of social media platforms to reach customers. Which of the following should be done FIRST to help mitigate the risk of confidential information being disclosed by employees on social media?

choices.A: Establish an organization-wide social media policy.
choices.B: Develop sanctions for misuse of social media sites.
choices.C: Monitor social media sites visited by employees.
choices.D: Restrict social media access on corporate devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Establish an organization-wide social media policy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should an information security manager do FIRST after identifying suspicious activity on a PC that is not in the organization's IT asset inventory?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
you first contain the issue, and later you will see why is not in the inventory...

Selected Answer: C
Going to have to go with my gut here. ISM always needs to validate/info gather what was identified. The best answer for that is to determine why the PC is not included in the inventory. I want to pick A, but the ISM would not be the one to go through with isolation, it would be his job to initiate incident response, the sys ads would than first isolate the affected system.

comments.content: Well, after a lot of thinking, I still think it's A. Besides, if it's not in the inventory, that means that some procedures haven't been followed (adding the system to the network, being it a company-owned or BYOD) and it's potentially a rogue device. So containment takes precedence in this case since suspicious activity has been identified, IMO.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Isolate the PC from the network

choices.C: Determine why the PC is not included in the inventory.
choices.A: Isolate the PC from the network
